intro: Bumelia depressa, commonly known as the flatleaf bumelia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Loganiaceae family and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and has smooth, dark green leaves with a slightly waxy texture. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, winged seeds. Bumelia depressa is often found in sandy or loamy soils and is adapted to humid, subtropical climates.
